Comments.Comment: J. A. Jacobs.Adam Hilger Ltd., Bristol, England; Accord, Mass., USA. 9+230 pp. Price £ 19.95, US$ 35.00 (1984). Entry.Title: Astrophysical techniques

Comments.Comment: C. R. Kitchin.Adam Hilger Ltd., Bristol, England. 12+438 pp. Price £ 40.00 cloth, £ 15.00 paper (1984). ISBN 0-85274-461-7 cloth, ISBN 0-85274-484-6 paper.Reviews in Astron. Express, Volume 1, Issue 2, p. 81 (1984); Spaceflight, Volume 26, Nr. 12, p. 476 (1984).Contents: 1. Detectors: optical and infrared detection, radio and microwave detection, X-ray and gamma-ray detection, cosmic ray detectors, neutrino detectors, gravitational radiation. 2. Imaging: photography, electronic imaging, scanning, interferometry, speckle interferometry, occultations, radar. 3. Photometry: photometry, photometers. 4. Spectroscopy: spectroscopy, spectroscopes. 5. Other techniques: astrometry, polarimetry, solar studies, magnetometry. Appendices I–IX.

Entry.Title: Physics of gravitating systems. I. Equilibrium and stability

Comments.Comment: A. M. Fridman, V. L. Polyachenko, translated by A. B. Aries, I. N. Poliakoff.Springer Verlag, New York - Berlin - Heidelberg - Tokyo. 17+468 pp. Price $ 97.30, DM 248.00 (1984). ISBN 0-387-11045-3 (USA), ISBN 3-540-11045-3 (F.R. Germany).Review in Nature, Volume 313, Nr. 6002, p. 507; 1985 (@cwyi@D. Lynden-Bell@cwqi@).Contents: Introduction. Theory: Equilibrium and stability of a nonrotating flat gravitating layer. Equilibrium and stability of a collisionless cylinder. Equilibrium and stability of collisionless spherically symmetrical systems. Equilibrium and stability of collisionless ellipsoidal systems. Equilibrium and stability of flat gravitating systems.

Entry.Title: Physics of gravitating systems. II. Nonlinear collective processes: nonlinear waves, solitons, collisionless shocks, turbulence. Astrophysical applications

Lynden-Bell@cwqi@).Contents: Theory: Non-Jeans instabilities of gravitating systems. Problems of nonlinear theory. Astrophysical applications: General remarks. Spherical systems. Ellipsoidal systems. Disk-like systems. Spiral structure. Other applications. Appendix.

Entry.Title: Secrets of the sun

Comments.Comment: R. G. Giovanelli.Cambridge University Press, Cambridge - London - New York - New Rochelle - Melbourne - Sydney. 11+116 pp. Price £ 11.95, US$ 19.95 (1984). ISBN 0-521-25521-X.Reviews in Astron. Express, Volume 1, Issue 2, p. 81 (1984); Astron. Tidsskr., Årg. 17, Nr. 4, p. 192 (1984); Nature, Volume 313, Nr. 6002, p. 508; 1985 (@cwyi@D. W. Hughes@cwqi@); Spaceflight, Volume 26, Nr. 11, p. 432 (1984). Contents: The sun as we see it. Inside the sun. The sun's curious rotation. Gases in motion. Those notorious sunspots. Magnetic fields outside sunspots and what they do. The sunspot cycle— what and why. Coming out from the sun— first the chromosphere. Coming out from the sun— the corona and beyond. Beauty and action— prominences. Action and beauty— flares. Sunspots and the weather.

Entry.Title: Die farbigen Dämmerungserscheinungen

Comments.Comment: K. Bullrich.Birkhäuser Verlag, Basel - Boston - Stuttgart. 104 pp. Price DM 26.80 (1982). ISBN 3-7643-1355-2.Contents: Einführung in die Grundlagen zur Erklärung der Himmelsfarben. Der vertikale Aufbau der Atmosphäre. Die spektrale Lichtstreuung und Lichtabsorption in der Atmosphäre. Die Molekülatmosphäre und das atmosphärische Aerosol. Das Erscheinungsbild des Ablaufs der Dämmerung. Die farbarme Dämmerung und die Leuchtdichteverteilung am Himmel nach Sonnenuntergang. Die leuchtenden Nachtwolken, das Nordlicht, das Nachthimmelslicht, das Zodiakallicht und die Perlmutterwolken.

Entry.Title: Atmospheric electrodynamics

Comments.Comment: H. Volland.Physics and Chemistry in Space, Volume 11. Springer-Verlag, Berlin - Heidelberg - New York - Tokyo. 9+205 pp. Price DM 98.00, $ 35.70 (1984). ISBN 3-540-13510-3 (F.R. Germany), ISBN 0-387-13510-3 (USA).Contents: Introduction. Plasma component of the air. Thunderstorms and related phenomena: global electric circuit, thunderstorms, thunderstorm electrification, lightning, Sferics. Tidal wind interaction with ionospheric plasma: electric @cwyi@Sq@cwqi@ and @cwyi@L@cwqi@ currents, ionospheric dynamo. Solar wind interaction with magnetosphere: coupling between solar wind and geomagnetic field, global magnetospheric electric fields and currents. Theory of wave propagation within the magnetosphere. Waves in the magnetosphere. Appendix.

Entry.Title: Cold plasma waves

Comments.Comment: H. G. Booker.Developments in Electromagnetic Theory and Applications, Volume 2. Martinus Nijhoff Publishers, Dordrecht - Boston - Lancaster. 15+349 pp. Price Dfl. 165.00, US$ 59.50, £ 41.95 (1984). ISBN 90-247-2977-7.Contents: Elementary properties of a plasma. Maxwell's equations. Isotropic plasma. Alternating current in a magnetoplasma. General properties of phase propagation in a magnetoplasma. General properties of group propagation in a magnetoplasma. Propagation of phase along the imposed magnetic field. Energy flow and group velocity for longitudinal propagation. Propagation of phase transverse to the imposed magnetic field. Elliptic polarization of the X wave for transverse propagation. Energy behaviour of the X wave for transverse propagation. Propagation at any angle to the imposed magnetic field. The radio approximation. The hydromagnetic approximation. The quasi-longitudinal and quasi-transverse approximations. Directional behaviour of group velocity in a magnetoplasma. The field of an antenna in a magnetoplasma. Directional behaviour of the power radiated by a dipole in a magnetoplasma.

Germany), ISBN 0-387-12561-2 (USA).Contents: Kinematics in inertial axes. Dynamics in inertial axes. Vacuum electrodynamics in inertial axes. Fields in media in uniform translation. Boundary-value problems for media in uniform translation. Electromagnetic forces and energy. Accelerated systems of reference. Gravitation. Maxwell's equations in a gravitational field. Electromagnetism of accelerated bodies. Field problems in a gravitational field.

Rotating black holes. Binary X-ray sources. Accretion onto black holes and neutron stars.

Entry.Title: Magnetic fields in astrophysics

Comments.Comment: Ya. B. Zeldovich (@cwyi@Ya. B. Zel'dovich@cwqi@), A. A. Ruzmaikin (@cwyi@A. A. Ruzmajkin@cwqi@), D. D. Sokoloff (@cwyi@D. D. Sokolov@cwqi@).The Fluid Mechanics of Astrophysics and Geophysics, Volume 3. Gordon and Breach Science Publishers, New York - London - Paris - Montreux - Tokyo. 16+365 pp. Price US$ 80.00, DM 321.00 (1983). ISBN 0-677-06380-6 (USA), ISBN 0-677-05530-7 (UK).Reviews in Astron. Express, Volume 1, Issue 3, p. 111 (1984); Geophys. Astrophys. Fluid Dyn., Volume 29, Nr. 4, p. 366–368; 1984 (@cwyi@U. Frisch, D. Galloway@cwqi@); Nature, Volume 313, Nr. 6003, p. 606; 1985 (@cwyi@L. Mestel@cwqi@).Contents: Introduction. Evidence of cosmic magnetism. Origin of magnetic fields. Dynamos. Conditions for magnetic field generation. The topology of flows in brief. Magnetic fields in stationary flows. Kinematic turbulent dynamos. The turbulent dynamo in a disk. Some topics in non-linear turbulent dynamo theory. Stellar cycles. The Galaxy and its magnetic field: observations. The galactic dynamo. The role of magnetic fields in star formation. Magnetic fields in cosmology. Accretion on black holes. Strong magnetic fields.
